headline: Robinhood Extends Rally as Speculation Over S&P 500 Inclusion Grows
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Robinhood Markets Inc. shares extended gains into a sixth straight day as investors speculate that the online brokerage could become the latest firm to earn a coveted spot in the S&P 500 Index. headline: S&P Giants And Record Highs
summary: Within the S&P 500, 32 stocks now have market caps of at least $250 billion. Of those, four have traded at all-time highs today. Click to read.

headline: BofA’s Hartnett Says Global Stocks Are Close to Sell Signal
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Global stocks are getting close to triggering a technical “sell” signal after reaching a record this week, warns Bank of America Corp. strategist Michael Hartnett, saying the market is running too hot after surging 20% in just two months.Most Read from BloombergNext Stop: Rancho Cucamonga!ICE Moves to DNA-Test Families Targeted for Deportation with New ContractWhere Public Transit Systems Are Bouncing Back Around the WorldUS Housing Agency Vulnerable to Fraud After DOGE Cuts, Docu

headline: Carmakers Use Stealth Price Hikes to Cope With Trump’s Tariffs
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Car buyers racing to get ahead of President Donald Trump’s tariffs face an uncomfortable truth — the trade war is already boosting US auto prices, often in ways nearly invisible to consumers. headline: Gold-Mining ETFs Losing Their Shine Following Torrid 2025 Rally
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Investors are exiting exchange-traded funds that track the shares of gold-mining companies, a sign that the high-flying sector’s allure may be dimming even as prices for the precious metal remain strong. headline: Automakers’ Bonds Are a Hot Trade Now That Tariffs Are in Limbo
summary: (Bloomberg) -- European carmakers are selling the most new bonds in years, seeking to take advantage of a calmer window in US President Donald Trump’s trade war as well as strong investor demand for the high yields on offer.Most Read from BloombergNext Stop: Rancho Cucamonga!ICE Moves to DNA-Test Families Targeted for Deportation with New ContractWhere Public Transit Systems Are Bouncing Back Around the WorldUS Housing Agency Vulnerable to Fraud After DOGE Cuts, Documents WarnThe Global Struggle
